_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1.  The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at the facility:
The Linde Gas facility located in Maumee, Ohio complies with NFPA requirements for LP Gas storage and applicable requirements for toxic substances and it is our policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state, and local laws.  If an emergency accidental release were to occur involving our propane, butane, isobutane/propane mixture, ammonia, chlorine, hydrogen chloride, hydrogen fluoride, hydrogen sulfide, sulfur dioxide, trimethylamine, or methylamine storage/handling systems, it is our policy to immediately notify the Monclova Fire Department and the Linde Gas Emergency Response Team, who would respond to the emergency.  In addition we have joint management and union safety committees as well as monthly safety training.

2.  A description of the facility and the regulated substances handled:
The Linde Gas - Maumee facility stores propane, butane, and an isobutane/propane mixture in above ground storage tanks (ASTs).  The liquified gases are transferred into storage cylinders of various sizes before they are sold and shipped from the facility.  The propane storage/handling process consists of one 14,400-gallon propane AST, one 18,000-gallon AST, cylinder filling equipment, filled cylinders of various sizes, and associated piping, valves, and other miscellaneous equipment.  Ammonia, chlorine, hydrogen chloride, hydrogen fluoride, hydrogen sulfide, sulfur dioxide, trimethylamine, and methylamine are stored at the Linde facility in cylinders only.  The cylinders are transported to the facility, stored for a period of time, and then shipped from the facility.  

3.  The general accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps:
The Linde Gas - Maumee facility complies with USEPA's accident prevention rule and all applicable federal, state, and local codes and regulations.  The propane system has been designed, installed, and maintained in accordance with N

FPA 58 and state law.

6.  Five-year accident history:
The Linde Gas - Maumee facility has has not had a reportable accident involving its propane, butane, isobutane/propane, ammonia, hydrogen sulfide, chlorine, hydrogen chloride, hydrogen fluoride, sulfur dioxide, trimethylamine, or methylamine storage/handling processes in the last five years.

7.  The emergency response program:
In the event of an emergency accidental release involving our covered processes, it is Linde Gas' policy to immediately notify the Monclova Fire Department and the Linde Gas Emergency Response Team, who would respond to the emergency.  The response team is equipped with personal protective gear including Level A.  We have communicated this policy with the Monclova Fire Department.  All members of the Linde Gas Emergency Response Team are properly trained to respond to emergencies at the facility.  All employees have access to Linde Gas' emergency action plan.  Emergency response training is conducted annually.  

8.  Planned changes to improve safety:          NONE
